programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Celtics and 76ers play Game 3 of their tied second-round set. Joel Embiid, who won his first MVP on May 2, returned from a knee injury in Game 2, but Boston dismantled his Philly side 121-87. Malcolm Brogdon (BOS) scored 23 points off the bench.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Nuggets try to put a stranglehold on the host Suns in Game 3 of their Western semifinal. Nikola Jokic posted 39 points and 16 rebounds and Denver pulled away from Phoenix in the fourth quarter for a 97-87 win in Game 2, and a 2-0 series lead.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Eastern Conference Semifinal, Game 4.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Dodgers' Julio Urías tries to keep his grip on the Padres in their series finale. Urías is 6-1 with a 2.19 ERA and 0.99 WHIP in 15 games against San Diego. The Padres send out Joe Musgrove, who makes his third appearance of the 2023 campaign.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The 76ers try to even their Eastern Conference semifinal against the Celtics in Game 4. Boston jumped ahead in the set with a 114-102 triumph in Game 3. Philadelphia has dropped both contests NBA MVP Joel Embiid has suited up for in the series.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Knicks and Heat shift their second-round series to South Beach, tied 1-1 entering Game 3. New York was inspired in Game 2 by the return of Julius Randle, who posted a 25-point, 12-rebound double-double to defeat Miami, sans Jimmy Butler, 111-105.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Coach Wade Phillips and the Houston Roughnecks bring back a familiar face to offset recent injuries. Tensions rise for coach Terrell Buckley and the winless Orlando Guardians, who host the Seattle Sea Dragons, a team looking to extend its win streak.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Terrell Buckley and the Orlando Guardians face their toughest test yet when they meet the ruthless D.C. Defenders defense. The Defenders then turn their attention in Week 8 to an intradivision matchup against the surging Seattle Sea Dragons.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: All-access with XFL players and coaches, such as AJ McCarron & Hines Ward. Co-owned by Dany Garcia & Dwayne Johnson, the league is where dreams meet opportunity.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years. But "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan is left to begin the 1997-98 season without his injured sidekick Scottie Pippen, whose contract dispute with the Bulls' front office reaches a fever pitch as the team gets off to one of the worst starts of its championship runs.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons' "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title.

programme.desc: Previewing major Top Rank boxing events with in-depth interviews and behind the scenes access to fighter training camps and their home lives.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Psychedelics may be the future of mental health treatment in sports. E60 follows a group of former athletes with a range of mental and physical conditions as they take part in a medical retreat involving psilocybin, aka Magic Mushrooms.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
